definition: in an opposing direction, a logical relation such that two propositions are contraries if both cannot be true but both can be false
details:
adjective
- in an opposing direction
= synonyms: adverse
- resistant to guidance or discipline
= example: resistant to guidance or discipline
= synonyms: perverse
- very opposed in nature or character or purpose
= example: very opposed in nature or character or purpose
- of words or propositions so related that both cannot be true but both may be false
= example: of words or propositions so related that both cannot be true but both may be false
noun
- a logical relation such that two propositions are contraries if both cannot be true but both can be false
- exact opposition
= example: exact opposition
- a relation of direct opposition
= synonyms: opposite
